The company commenced operations on 1st April 2002 with the primary purpose of providing cheque clearing facilities to all commercial banks in Sri Lanka on behalf of the CBSL. In 2013, CBSL appointed LCPL to operate the National Common Card and Payment Switch (CCAPS) which is an integrated electronic payment system of multiple domestic payment networks such as Common ATM Switch (CAS), Common POS Switch (CPS), Common Electronic Fund Transfer Switch (CEFTS) and Common Mobile Switch (CMobS) of which the CAS is now in live operation.  Key roles and responsibilities: • 	Mainly responsible for providing first level support on the national payment network infrastructure which connects all state banks and commercial banks of Sri Lanka. • 	Mananage and troubleshoot layer-2 network security controls such as, port security, spanning tree, BPDU filters, VLAN and AAA security to ensure on-going compliance with industry security standards. •	Manage and monitor security logs for the LCPL network infrastructure using SIEM solution. This includes adding new log sources, normalizing logs, aggregating logs and designing dashboards for event monitoring

headline: Network Engineer - London Stock Exchange Group
summary: A strong collaborator and creative problem solver who possess a demonstrated background in the implementation and maintenance of complex networks with 8+ years work experience. I have specialized in Network Engineering and Information Security  and have a proven track record of successful employment in the mentioned categorizations.
organization_description_1: * Managing global wide-area and firewall network ensuring smooth trading operation. Thorough exposure to products such as Cisco , Juniper , Fortigate , F5 , Radware were obtaided.  * Responsible for implementing firewall configurations to support company standards and carry migration, upgrades of network elements with to ensure the rebustness on the underlying infrastructure.  * Co-ordinate with stakeholders in troubleshooting network infrastructure related complaints and resolve within the provided SLA's.  * Perform continuous checks on network infrastructure for its health and resiliency and take prompt action on and monitored abnormalities.
organization_description_2: * Level 2,3 support for Large Enterprise segment of customer base on all fixed line solutions & analyzing the summary of customer complaints to avoid repeating issues to ensure high quality of service. I was mainly exposed to following technologies & products.  1) Corporate voice solutions (E 1 / VoIP / SIP Trunks/ Hosted PBX)  2) Internet Leased Lines – Ensure high speed dedicated lines are provided to meet agreed SLA & path / routing optimizations (via router        models - Cisco 800 , 1800 , 1900 , 3400 series , ASR 1k etc)  3) WiFi  (Platform – Cisco , Erikson)  4) VPN (L2/L3) - Manage VPN’s Provided from MPLS network, Troubleshoot issues related to QoS, Security & routing protocols etc. (Platform – Cisco)  5) Fixed 4G LTE Solutions - Voice & Data  (Platform Huawei , Cisco)  6) Firewalls – Make sure strict security is provided to customer network with access controlled (Platform - Fortinet & Ubuntu)  7) Monitor & Manage Access Network (Alwarian , Huawei , Airspan , Motorolla based access links via Whatsup Gold , Solarwind, Nagios SNMP monitoring tools)
organization_description_3: Assist the corporate customer base by troubleshooting the reported technical problems at priority & directly interact with them. Main areas I have to attend are,    1) IP Routing – Troubleshooting related to Routing protocols such as BGP, OSPF are performed.  2) VPN – Layer 2/3 Virtual Private Network creation & management is done. (Platform – Cisco , Mikrotik)  3) VoIP – A very popular feature nowadays & technical problems related to efficient routing, Quality of Service are commonly handled.  4) Video Streaming – A time sensitive service that needs immediate attention if a problem is reported.  I’ve gained IP Multicasting related skills when troubleshooting.  5) WiFi – Another popular & common application in hotels & resorts. IEEE 802.1b/g/n standard based checking & frequent issues like signal interfering, wireless coverage, mobility, user authentication affect WiFi frequently. (Platform – Ubiquity, Mikrotik)  6) IPLC – When troubleshooting International Private Lease Circuits, I’m required to communicate with foreign engineering teams & analyze the issue with them. Checking international path for QoS in necessary.  7) Backbone link monitoring – Responding to alarming system & taking preventive actions is performed. Traffic routing to backup paths & restoration of original links has to be done.  Ultimate goal expected from me is to keep the network up and running without interruptions & provide outstanding technical assistance for customers.   I have undergone a special training at Lankacom Internet department which mainly focused on Cisco Technologies, Designing & maintaining the core ISP backbone at Layer 3, Implementing efficient routing , Last mile IP connectivity provisioning  & troubleshooting etc.

headline: Network and Security Engineer | CCNP | NSE4 | JNCIA | F5-101
summary: An experienced network professional with over seven years of experience in building and maintaining complex network and security solutions.
organization_description_2: Part of the Network and Communications team, managing the network and security infrastructure of the Commercial Bank of Ceylon and the subsidiary banking units operating in Bangladesh and Maldives.  Part of the Network and Communications team, managing the network and security infrastructure of the Commercial Bank of Ceylon and the subsidiary banking units operating in Bangladesh and Maldives.  Key Responsibilities:  • Design, implementation and management of all network and security solutions across all regions. • Ensuring the availability of highly critical systems and data to both internal staff and external parties. • Attending to security alerts and taking necessary measurements to minimize impact. • Liaising with the IT-Security team in security incident handling and remediation. • Fine-tuning IPS/WAF security policies and SIEM use-cases to minimize false positive alerts. • Identifying application and network issues using packet and log analysis. • Analyzing, prioritizing and implementing remediation actions to address vulnerability scan reports. • Ensuring network security controls and device configurations are compliant with ISO and PCIDSS standards. • Administration of five firewall clusters. (Cisco ASA 5585, Fortigate 600D, 90D). • Administration of F5 BIG-IP load balancing cluster. • Administration of Imperva Secure Sphere Web Application Firewall. • Administration of Cisco Web Security Appliance (Proxy). • Administration and fine-tuning of LogRhythm SIEM.
organization_description_3: Involved in ‘BigAir Group ISP’ managed services project as a Network Engineer providing Level 2 support, for corporate and small business customer’s network solutions. Configure and Troubleshoot BigAir, Anittel, and IIPC wholesale and Corporate Service Provider Networks, as well as University lodges, Student accommodation networks in Australia, equipped with Cisco, Juniper, MikroTik and Ubiquiti gear.  Key Responsibilities:  • Managing and troubleshooting the BigAir MPLS infrastructure and customer networks. • Configuring and troubleshooting Cisco, Juniper and Mikrotik routers and switches. • Performance monitoring and troubleshooting Ubiquity/Motorola/DragonWave microwave devices. • Managing and troubleshooting Cisco & Ruckus wireless controllers and access points. • Adhering to established processes and change management policies to ensure awareness, approval, and success of changes made to the network infrastructure. • Ensuring system availability and reliability by configuring proactive monitoring. (Smokeping, Cacti, Solarwinds).
organization_description_4: Involved in ‘Airtel Sri Lanka Internet Services’ managed services project in a 24/7 NOC environment to provide reliable internet services to around 3 million of Mobile broadband users as well as to provide dedicated internet connections to corporate clients.  Key Responsibilities:  • Configuring and managing Bharti Airtel Lanka ISP Network to provide secure and reliable internet services to around 3 million customers. • Configuring and managing Bharti Airtel Lanka corporate customer lease lines project which includes functions such as implementation and customer fault troubleshooting. (Juniper EX4550, EX2200, MX104, SRX240) • Configuring and managing Bharti Airtel Lanka corporate wireless infrastructure which serve around 200 customers with Cisco 5508 Series Wireless Controllers and Cisco Access Points. • Configuring and managing EBGP and IBGP peers with number of service providers locally and internationally on Cisco XR 12000 routers and load balancing customer traffic over ISP links using BGP traffic engineering. • Performing continuous routing checks and proactively monitoring of ISP network services to identify core network drops and latencies. • Planning and implementing network and security policies to provide connectivity between DMZ and Intranet components through ISP backbone firewalls. (Cisco ASA 5585) • Configuring and maintaining remote access and site-to-site VPN solutions and troubleshooting VPN connectivity drops. • Carrying out network device deployments including configurations, device racking, patching and testing. • Planning and carrying out operational and maintenance activities in adherence to the Business Continuity Plan agreed. • Drafting and maintaining change/issue management documents, network diagrams and network upgrade plans.
organization_description_6: Involved in ‘Airtel Sri Lanka Internet Services’ managed services project as a network support intern.  Key Responsibilities:  • Providing level 1 technical support and working with level 2 and level 3 network teams to identify, troubleshoot and solve network issues. • Performing health checks and proactively monitoring ISP network services to identify core network drops, backbone route changes and manage latency. • Drafting and maintaining change/issue management documents and network diagrams. • Escalating international provider links and device faults to vendors and third party Internet Service Providers and coordinating till resolution. • Configuration of network monitoring tools to identify utilization/performance issues of ISP links and infrastructure (Cacti, Solarwinds, Manage-Engine Netflow).

My objective is to work hard with dedication while acquiring new knowledge in the field of Telecommunication, Computer Networks and Computer Systems Management to serve for the betterment to the world  Technical Proficiency :  * Planning, configuring and installation - FTTx via TDM-GPON ( G.984 ) ( Raisecom ) * Planning, configuring and installation - Wi-Max 16e Network ( Airspan, Purewave and Runcom ) * Configuring and installation - EMS,NMS of above systems * Configuring and installation - AAA server with RADIUS/Diameter protocols  * Configuring and installation - LTE Airspan eNodeB (Uu and S1 interface) to connect EPC * Cisco SW ( 2950,2960 ,3750 ) - Configuring 802.1Q, VTP, VLANs, STP, Etherchannel  * Cisco Router (1800 and 2800,1900,7200 series) - Implementing NAT,ACL, OSPF,     EIGRP,HSRP,GLBP,BGP,MPLS * Cisco ASA 5505,5510,5520 - Configuring both NAT and transparent modes

summary: An adaptable, enthusiastic and dedicated Network Engineer with significant hands-on  technical experience over 10 years who enjoys being part of a successful and productive  team. organization_description_3: •Managing, planning, testing & troubleshooting various pieces of customer design elements on the Gamma MPLS network. • Working on the MPLS network and customer CPE to help resolve customer issues in areas like layer 2/3 routing, resiliency, QoS, policy-based routing, spanning tree etc. • Migrating customer circuits on the Gamma MPLS to different hubs for resiliency and capacity management. • Providing technical input for the Solution Design engineers on improving areas of existing customer designs on the company MPLS network and maintain/update TDD. • Building & configuring circuits using Cisco managed products (Converged Ethernet, MPLS and Managed DSL products) • Palo Alto firewalls – dealing with faults & change requests as well as troubleshooting issues with customer solutions. • Managing complex routing, switching & firewall changes to meet customer requirements (using Cisco/Juniper/ One Access routers, switches & Palo Alto firewalls) • Configuring VPN access to cloud base providers such as Azure and AWS. • Providing a support escalation point for other customer facing teams. • Part of the on call rota. • Configuring and deploying QoS on CE to support converged data and voice networks • Creating & provisioning IPSEC tunnels to allow routing as per customer requirements.
organization_description_4: - Troubleshoot internet/network related issues (Ethernet over Copper, wireless, ADSL, Footfall Counters and VOIP) - Remote support and access to customer premises equipment (Multi-Vendor Switches, Cisco Routers, HP Switches, Aruba Access Points/Controllers & Juniper Firewalls ) and analyse the device logs to find out the root causes for any reported issues and perform required maintenance tasks or any configuration changes on the networking equipment to rectify the reported issues. - Liaise with the wholesale & upstream service providers (BT,Nuvoli, Easynet) to rectify any issues identified to be on their networks or the Cisco routers managed by them. - Setup/ Troubleshoot issues with cisco VPN connections. - Monitor store networks via SolarWinds. - Configure and troubleshoot Mitel desk phones. - Support worldwide retail clients for both POS hardware and software and also back office and mail order systems. - Server 2008/2012 management and maintenance and extensive Microsoft Office support – 2007, 2010 and 2013 - Active Directory; the creation of new users, security groups, group policies, housekeeping and scripting. - Advanced desktop support for both Windows (7, 8 and 10) and Apple operating systems ( OSX and iOS)    - Install, configure and update database MS SQL 2005 or 2008, DB2.     - Maintain monitor and update database on daily basis.    - Database recovery and back ups.    - Resource management and co-ordination of 3rd party suppliers.    - Support the testing and migration of customer SAP system. - Software print solution support for print server software such as Papercut, Equitrac and Uniflow - Printer hardware support - Microsoft Exchange management, maintenance and support Office365 migrations.
organization_description_5: - Troubleshoot data (SHDSL, Ethernet over Copper, Fibre, wireless, Optical Fiber and ADSL) and VOIP, services provisioned for Exetel’s residential & corporate customer base and also troubleshooting the problems associated with servers such as DHCP, DNS, e-mail, Web & FTP. - Liaising with the wholesale & upstream service providers (Telstra, AAPT, Optus etc.) to rectify any issues identified to be on their networks which affect the performance of the services provided by Exetel. - Monitoring MRTG Reports. - Monitoring corporate customer's connections with the use of Nagios. - Keeping Exetel forums and knowledge base up to date. - Building & Deploying complex LAN & WAN solutions and configuring cisco devices and other Network devices. - Have a thorough understanding of telecommunication regulatory and compliance issues in Australia and advise/respond to end user accordingly. - Liaise with Level 3 CORE Engineers in Australia for resolving advanced technical problems/service issues.

headline: Senior Network Engineer at London Stock Exchange Group (LSEG)
summary: An enthusiastic network security engineer with six (06) years of hands on experience and great passion to gain knowledge in networking and network security. Always stay up to date with the latest technologies in the field. An excellent team player with experience on challenging goals, working to tight deadlines and deep analytical skills. Experience mainly includes network security planning and operations including working with leading security products such as Palo Alto, Fortigate and Cisco Firewalls, HP ArcSight Security Information and Event Management, Tufin Firewall Optimizing and  Analyzing Tool, ForeScout Network Access Control, Qualys Vulnerability Management, etc.
organization_description_3: Network Engineer – Network Security Operations and Planning LankaClear (Pvt) Ltd., SRI LANKA January 2014 – Present  LankaClear (Pvt) Ltd (LCPL) is a limited liability company incorporated in Sri Lanka in 2002 and jointly owned by the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) and the Licensed Commercial Banks in Sri Lanka. The company commenced operations on 1st April 2002 with the primary purpose of providing cheque clearing facilities to all commercial banks in Sri Lanka on behalf of the CBSL. In 2013, CBSL appointed LCPL to operate the National Common Card and Payment Switch (CCAPS) which is an integrated electronic payment system of multiple domestic payment networks such as Common ATM Switch (CAS), Common POS Switch (CPS), Common Electronic Fund Transfer Switch (CEFTS) and Common Mobile Switch (CMobS) of which the CAS is now in live operation.   Key roles and responsibilities:  	Mainly responsible for providing second level support on the national payment network infrastructure which connects all state banks and commercial banks of Sri Lanka. 	Configure initial connectivity between commercial/state banks and LCPL using mGRE tunnels and EIGRP routing and provide on-going support. 	Implement, manage and troubleshoot IPSEC tunnels between LCPL and commercial/state banks to ensure secure communication. 	Configure and fine tune WAN optimization and SD-WAN solution between head office and disaster recovery sites. 	Configure and manage high availability, UTM features and access rules on perimeter and internal security defenses. 	Implement, manage and troubleshoot layer-2 network security controls such as, port security, spanning tree, BPDU filters, VLAN and AAA security to ensure on-going compliance with industry security standards. 	Manage and monitor security logs for the LCPL network infrastructure using SIEM solution. This includes adding new log sources, normalizing logs, aggregating logs and designing dashboards for event monitoring.
organization_description_4: Associate Duty Engineer Lanka Communication Services (Pvt) Ltd., SRI LANKA January 2012 - January 2014  Lanka Communication Services (Pvt) Ltd. (LankaCom) is a pioneer in providing Data Communication and Internet Services in Sri Lanka. LankaCom is a subsidiary of Singapore Telecommunications Limited (SingTel), offer corporate communication services to the Sri Lankan market which includes a product portfolio of Internet, Intranet, Video Conferencing, International Leased Line Circuits, etc.  Key roles and responsibilities:  	Provide Internet and VPN connections and manage LankaCom Core and Backbone Networks. 	Planning and supporting networking and computing infrastructure. 	Identifying, troubleshoot and rectify issues related to customer leased line circuits. 	Monitor international circuits (IPLS/IPVPN). 	Implement and provide on-going support for wireless access points at customer premises (Ubiquiti Access points).  	Provide 24x7 customer support in Network Management Center (NMC) and Network Operating Center (NOC).

headline: Network Engineer
summary: Certifications  CCNP Routing and Switching CCNP Security
organization_description_1: a. ROUTING Configuration and management of BGP protocol, especially in a Multi Homing environment. Aggregated routes are used to keep redundancy between the peering. Loopback peering allows to keep the traffic to load balance between the physical international circuits. Security side bgp was used to configure “Remotely triggered black hole routing (RTBH)” technique to prevent the provider network against various Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) attacks.  Policy Based Routing and multiple other dynamic routing protocols are configured within the Service Provider network. Such as OSPF, EIGRP and etc. Cisco HSRP protocol is configured to manage the core network redundancy. IPSEC over GRE Tunnel configuration and management are used for various ISP and Datacenter requirements.  b. SWITCHING Configuration and Management of Spanning Tree protocol versions. Such as RSTP, MSTP and etc. Virtual Trunking Protocol (VTP) is configured across Layer 2 domains to manage VLANs. Multiple 802.1Q tunneling (Q-in-Q) is configured to provide layer 2 VPN services for subscribers.  c. Multiprotocol Label Switching (MPLS) MPLS is enabled and managed between multiple Provider Edge (PE) routers through multiple Provider (P) routers of the Service Provider. Multiple MPLS L3VPN are configured between PE routers as per Corporate client requirements.  d. Virtual Private Network (VPN) Multiple VPN technologies are configured and managed to provide various services to the clients. They are DMVPN, IPSec Site-to-Site VPN and MPLS L3VPN.  e. Quality of Service (QoS) Quality of Service is configured and managed for bandwidth restriction, through packet marking (ToS/DSCP) apply prioritization to applications or traffic, depends on the business requirement.  f. SECURITY Configuration and management of firewall policies on various vendor platforms. Experience through security attacks DDOS, IP Spoofing, DHCP snooping and etc.  g. TRAFFIC OPTIMIZATION AND LOAD BALANCING
organization_description_2: Management of Engineering department staffs. Handling of staffs regular HR issues at a certain level and daily task assignments. Having qualified with City & Guilds of London Examination for Telecommunication, I began my carrier in Sri Lanka as a Trainee Electronics Technician at Metropolitan Agencies Limited in 1988 (Cannon Products). Henceforth I have served in leading private sector ICT companies in various capacities such as Field Engineer (IBM Products - EWIS), Customer Services Engineer and Senior Customer Services Engineer (UNISYS Products - BC Computers), Field Operations Supervisor / Assistant Manager (Desk top Lottery POS - GTECH), Technical Engineer (Palm top Lottery POS - Oceanic Games) and Network Engineer (Payment Gateway - Webxpay).  My present designation at WEBXPAY (Pvt) Limited, is Network Engineer. But I cover the areas of responsibility of Head of IT Infrastructure, Systems Engineer, Support & Release Engineer and Systems / Network Administrator and directly reporting to the Chairman  & CEO.  Other than that, during my five years’ experience at BC Computers Limited (Bartleet Group), where I handled Main Frames, Multi-Processor Super Mini Systems, Mini Systems & PCs installed in Leading Banks & Financial Organizations in Sri Lanka and also the Colombo Stock Exchange, International Banking Network (SWIFT) as well as Lanka Clear as a Senior Engineer / Team Leader.  And also, my longstanding 25 years carrier experience as a Computer Engineer, have evolved me to comprehend insightful knowledge to deal with the total retailer database of the Mahapola Online Lottery at Aitken Spence Gtech (Pvt) Limited and also Oceanic Games (Pvt) Limited ().   I have already completed course work of commercial certificates such as CISCO Certified Network Associate (CCNA), Microsoft Windows Server 2012 r2 and also ITIL (V3). summary: I am a Cisco Certified Network Professional with excellent academic background, creative capability and soft skills. organization_description_3: Perform troubleshooting for the data (SHDSL, Ethernet over Copper, Fibre, wireless and ADSL) and VOIP, services provisioned for Exeter’s corporate customer base and also troubleshooting the problems associated with servers such as DHCP, DNS, e-mail, Web & FTP.  Remotely Log in to the Customer premises equipment (Multi-Vendor Routers & Firewalls ) and analyze the device logs to find out the root causes for any reported issues and perform required maintenance tasks or any configuration changes on the networking equipment to rectify the reported issues. Monitor & manage Exetel’s core network while performing configuration changes/new configuration (Commissioning of new links, circuit upgrades/terminations, MPLS, Dynamic (BGP & OSPF) & static routing), on the network devices in the core network to meet the customer requirements.

organization_title_1: Senior Network Engineer - Global Network Services
organization_description_1: o Working as a part of global network supporting team maintaining the entire Pearson global network including data center, office, cloud and hybrid cloud environment, which consists of managing the Routers, Switches, Firewalls, Load Balancers & DNS servers. o Monitor the availability of the network to maintain the pre-signed service level agreement and perform routine maintenance.  o As a company which strictly follow ITIL standard we provide support for the business as usual tasks received as incident ticket within the aggreged service level agreements and raise and execute Change Records in accordance with departmental change policy.  o Configuring both carrier grade (ASR) and enterprise level (ISR 19xx/29xx/39xx) Cisco routers and Configuring both enterprise level (Catalyst 65xx, 37xx, 29xx) and data center (Nexus 7k, 5k, 2k, 3k) grade switches. o Providing support for customers from legacy data center environment to hybrid cloud environments including AWS, GCP and Azure using different cloud formation technologies and Terraform.  o Configuring and maintaining enterprise grade WLAN solutions from both Cisco and Meraki. o Configuring and managing the F5 LTM ,GTM,ASM,AS3 and BigIQ clusters to support daily operations. o DNS troubleshooting & configuring – Infoblox platforms. o Negotiate and maintain relationships with hardware and software vendors
organization_description_3: My work as a Senior Engineer - Voice core operations spans from 2G, 3G legacy circuit switching voice core operations to the next generation voice services such as VoLTE and VoWiFi services.  1) Responsible of operations and maintenance of IMS core network nodes, including A-SBC, IMS-CGP, 3rd Party applications servers (TAS servers), SPG, UIM, IMS-HSS, MGCF and IMMGW. I work as a primary operation and maintenance Engineer of the Mobitel IMS core providing troubleshooting, system upgrade and upgrade support, new service provisioning and testing, technical solution evaluation on IMS related services.   2) Performing the software and hardware maintainance of the circuit switching core network nodes such as MSC, MGW, HSS, STP and VAS platforms such as CRBT.   3) Perform capacity planning, dimension , and implementation of the expansion of existing network elements
organization_description_4: Currently I am working in Switching operations division which is responsible troubleshooting, Operations and Maintaining Voice core nodes( MSC,MGW, HLR, HSS, STP and CRBT).  1) Familiar in installing, configuring and troubleshooting Huawei VMSCs (MSOFTX3000), Currently at Mobitel we have 2 MSOFTX3000 architectures, CPCI (Compact PCI architecture) and ATCA (Advanced Telecommunication Architecture). ACTA is a fully IP based architecture which supports SS7 and Sigtran Protocols.  2) Familiar in installing, configuring and troubleshooting Huawei VMGWs (UMG8900), Currently I am familiar with the UMG8900 version V009R200 version for controlling and routing of Voice traffic (Support both Packet Switching and Circuit Switching).  3) Currently at Mobitel Network we are deploying a Huawei IMS (IP Multimedia Sub-System) for catering the voice services on 4G LTE technology using VoIP. Therefore I am currently participating the initial configurations, PAT and POC with Huawei personals.   4)  And also for catering the 4G data domain requirement we have deployed a Huawei EPC (Extended Packet Core) system and I was able to participate training session conducted by Huawei for the system and therefore I have good theoretical knowledge on that as well. The course covers (MME, HSS, S-GW, P-GW PCRF and DNS).
